name: Custom Translator
helpText:
Custom Translator

The main responsibility of a translator is to convert the contents of the payload, not the type. The purpose of this translator is to support any type of transformation required, implemented by a bespoke translator class.

componentName.helpText: The name of the component as displayed on diagrams, space are encouraged, succinct is best. The name should be unique for the flow. The name will be used internally to reflect the bean created.

configurable.helpText: This property reflects that a component has the necessary configuration setup so that it can be edited in the blue console. Its is more of a status and as such is not explicitly used.

userImplementedClassName.helpText: The name of the class that contain the custom translation, the IDE will create a template for this class, the user  must provide the implementation.
userImplementedClassName.validationMessage: Provide a valid java classname for the translator e.g. starting with upper case, followed by number/characters etc.

type.helpText: The type of data we expect to come into the translator. This can be any Java class.
type.validationMessage: Provide a fully qualified Java class name to be used as the type for the input to the translator.
